metadata.Title: CVE-2020-2806 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Compiling). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.28 andprior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attackerwith network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized abilityto cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQLServer. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 5.3 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-2806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.29-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.29-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.29-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.29-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.29-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.29-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.29-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.29-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.29-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.29-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.29-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
